channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: How 2026 Could Decide the Future of Artificial Intelligence
item.description: Six CFR fellows examine the challenges that lie ahead, reviewing how governance, adoption, and geopolitical competition will shape artificial intelligence and society’s engagement with this new technology.

item.title: How Will the Trump Administration Respond to Violent Protests in Iran?
item.description: Protests are once again raging in Iran. Will the outcome be different?

item.title: Everything Is Connected
item.description: This week, Bill Reinsch describes how policy can have unintended consequences and the importance of having processes that allow for informed decisionmaking.

item.title: The Geopolitics of Maduro’s Capture: China’s Future in Latin America Following Operation Absolute Resolve
item.description: CSIS Americas Program Director Ryan C. Berg assesses the implications of the recent U.S. capture of Nicolás Maduro for China's strategy in the Western Hemisphere.

item.title: Civil Takedowns: The Missing Legal Framework for Cyber Disruption
item.description: The United States can fight cybercrime more effectively by scaling court-authorized, private sector takedowns of criminal infrastructure—but procedural friction, evidentiary uncertainty, and cost asymmetry keep use of this tool limited. It’s time to address barriers.
